content:
Vector3 Struct

Definition

Represents a vector with three single-precision floating-point values.

In this Article

public struct Vector3 : IEquatable<System.Numerics.Vector3>, IFormattable
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
Vector3

Remarks

The Vector3 structure provides support for hardware acceleration.

Constructors

Vector3(Single)

Creates a new Vector3 object whose three elements have the same value.

public Vector3 (float value);
value
Single

The value to assign to all three elements.

Vector3(Vector2,Single)

Creates a new Vector3 object from the specified Vector2 object and the specified value.

public Vector3 (System.Numerics.Vector2 value, float z);
value
Vector2

The vector with two elements.

z
Single

The additional value to assign to the Z field.

Vector3(Single,Single,Single)

Creates a vector whose elements have the specified values.

public Vector3 (float x, float y, float z);
x
Single

The value to assign to the X field.

y
Single

The value to assign to the Y field.

z
Single

The value to assign to the Z field.

Fields

X

The X component of the vector.

public float X;

Y

The Y component of the vector.

public float Y;

Z

The Z component of the vector.

public float Z;

Properties

One

Gets a vector whose 3 elements are equal to one.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 One { get; }
Value
Vector3

A vector whose three elements are equal to one (that is, it returns the vector (1,1,1).

UnitX

Gets the vector (1,0,0).

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 UnitX { get; }
Value
Vector3

The vector (1,0,0).

UnitY

Gets the vector (0,1,0).

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 UnitY { get; }
Value
Vector3

The vector (0,1,0)..

UnitZ

Gets the vector (0,0,1).

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 UnitZ { get; }
Value
Vector3

The vector (0,0,1).

Zero

Gets a vector whose 3 elements are equal to zero.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Zero { get; }
Value
Vector3

A vector whose three elements are equal to zero (that is, it returns the vector (0,0,0).

Methods

Abs(Vector3)

Returns a vector whose elements are the absolute values of each of the specified vector's elements.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Abs (System.Numerics.Vector3 value);
value
Vector3

A vector.

Returns
Vector3

The absolute value vector.

Add(Vector3,Vector3)

Adds two vectors together.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Add (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector to add.

right
Vector3

The second vector to add.

Returns
Vector3

The summed vector.

Clamp(Vector3,Vector3,Vector3)

Restricts a vector between a minimum and a maximum value.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Clamp (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 min, System.Numerics.Vector3 max);
value1
Vector3

The vector to restrict.

min
Vector3

The minimum value.

max
Vector3

The maximum value.

Returns
Vector3

The restricted vector.

CopyTo(Single[])

Copies the elements of the vector to a specified array.

public void CopyTo (float[] array);
array
Single[]

The destination array.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentException

The number of elements in the current instance is greater than in the array.

RankException

array is multidimensional.

Remarks

array must have at least three elements. The method copies the vector's elements starting at index 0.

CopyTo(Single[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the vector to a specified array starting at a specified index position.

public void CopyTo (float[] array, int index);
array
Single[]

The destination array.

index
Int32

The index at which to copy the first element of the vector.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentException

The number of elements in the current instance is greater than in the array.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

-or-

index is greater than or equal to the array length.

RankException

array is multidimensional.

Remarks

array must have a sufficient number of elements to accommodate the three vector elements. In other words, elements index, index + 1, and index + 2 must already exist in array.

Cross(Vector3,Vector3)

Computes the cross product of two vectors.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Cross (System.Numerics.Vector3 vector1, System.Numerics.Vector3 vector2);
vector1
Vector3

The first vector.

vector2
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The cross product.

Distance(Vector3,Vector3)

Computes the Euclidean distance between the two given points.

public static float Distance (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 value2);
value1
Vector3

The first point.

value2
Vector3

The second point.

Returns
Single

The distance.

DistanceSquared(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns the Euclidean distance squared between two specified points.

public static float DistanceSquared (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 value2);
value1
Vector3

The first point.

value2
Vector3

The second point.

Returns
Single

The distance squared.

Divide(Vector3,Vector3)

Divides the first vector by the second.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Divide (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector.

right
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The vector resulting from the division.

Divide(Vector3,Single)

Divides the specified vector by a specified scalar value.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Divide (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, float divisor);
left
Vector3

The vector.

divisor
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Vector3

The vector that results from the division.

Dot(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns the dot product of two vectors.

public static float Dot (System.Numerics.Vector3 vector1, System.Numerics.Vector3 vector2);
vector1
Vector3

The first vector.

vector2
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Single

The dot product.

Equals(Vector3)

Returns a value that indicates whether this instance and another vector are equal.

public bool Equals (System.Numerics.Vector3 other);
other
Vector3

The other vector.

Returns
Boolean

true if the two vectors are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two vectors are equal if their Vector3, Vector3, and Vector3 elements are equal.

Equals(Object)

Returns a value that indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
Object

The object to compare with the current instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if the current instance and obj are equal; otherwise, false```. If <code>obj</code> isnull, the method returnsfalse`.

Remarks

The current instance and obj are equal if obj is a Vector3 object and their corresponding elements are equal.

GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this instance.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

The hash code.

Length()

Returns the length of this vector object.

public float Length ();
Returns
Single

The vector's length.

LengthSquared()

Returns the length of the vector squared.

public float LengthSquared ();
Returns
Single

The vector's length squared.

Remarks

This operation offers better performance than a call to the Length method.

Lerp(Vector3,Vector3,Single)

Performs a linear interpolation between two vectors based on the given weighting.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Lerp (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 value2, float amount);
value1
Vector3

The first vector.

value2
Vector3

The second vector.

amount
Single

A value between 0 and 1 that indicates the weight of value2.

Returns
Vector3

The interpolated vector.

Max(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns a vector whose elements are the maximum of each of the pairs of elements in two specified vectors.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Max (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 value2);
value1
Vector3

The first vector.

value2
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The maximized vector.

Min(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns a vector whose elements are the minimum of each of the pairs of elements in two specified vectors.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Min (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, System.Numerics.Vector3 value2);
value1
Vector3

The first vector.

value2
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The minimized vector.

Multiply(Vector3,Vector3)

Multiplies two vectors together.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Multiply (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector.

right
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The product vector.

Multiply(Vector3,Single)

Multiplies a vector by a specified scalar.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Multiply (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, float right);
left
Vector3

The vector to multiply.

right
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Vector3

The scaled vector.

Multiply(Single,Vector3)

Multiplies a scalar value by a specified vector.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Multiply (float left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Single

The scaled value.

right
Vector3

The vector.

Returns
Vector3

The scaled vector.

Negate(Vector3)

Negates a specified vector.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Negate (System.Numerics.Vector3 value);
value
Vector3

The vector to negate.

Returns
Vector3

The negated vector.

Normalize(Vector3)

Returns a vector with the same direction as the specified vector, but with a length of one.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Normalize (System.Numerics.Vector3 value);
value
Vector3

The vector to normalize.

Returns
Vector3

The normalized vector.

Reflect(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns the reflection of a vector off a surface that has the specified normal.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Reflect (System.Numerics.Vector3 vector, System.Numerics.Vector3 normal);
vector
Vector3

The source vector.

normal
Vector3

The normal of the surface being reflected off.

Returns
Vector3

The reflected vector.

SquareRoot(Vector3)

Returns a vector whose elements are the square root of each of a specified vector's elements.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 SquareRoot (System.Numerics.Vector3 value);
value
Vector3

A vector.

Returns
Vector3

The square root vector.

Subtract(Vector3,Vector3)

Subtracts the second vector from the first.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Subtract (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector.

right
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The difference vector.

ToString()

Returns the string representation of the current instance using default formatting.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

The string representation of the current instance.

Remarks

This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using the "G" (general) format string and the formatting conventions of the current thread culture. The "<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the current culture's NumberGroupSeparator property followed by a space is used to separate each element.

ToString(String)

Returns the string representation of the current instance using the specified format string to format individual elements.

public string ToString (string format);
format
String

A standard or custom numeric format string that defines the format of individual elements.

Returns
String

The string representation of the current instance.

Remarks

This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using format and the current culture's formatting conventions. The "<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the current culture's NumberGroupSeparator property followed by a space is used to separate each element.

ToString(String,IFormatProvider)

Returns the string representation of the current instance using the specified format string to format individual elements and the specified format provider to define culture-specific formatting.

public string ToString (string format, IFormatProvider formatProvider);
format
String

A standard or custom numeric format string that defines the format of individual elements.

formatProvider
IFormatProvider

A format provider that supplies culture-specific formatting information.

Returns
String

The string representation of the current instance.

Remarks

This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using format and formatProvider. The "<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the format provider's NumberGroupSeparator property followed by a space is used to separate each element.

Transform(Vector3,Matrix4x4)

Transforms a vector by a specified 4x4 matrix.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Transform (System.Numerics.Vector3 position, System.Numerics.Matrix4x4 matrix);
position
Vector3

The vector to transform.

matrix
Matrix4x4

The transformation matrix.

Returns
Vector3

The transformed vector.

Transform(Vector3,Quaternion)

Transforms a vector by the specified Quaternion rotation value.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 Transform (System.Numerics.Vector3 value, System.Numerics.Quaternion rotation);
value
Vector3

The vector to rotate.

rotation
Quaternion

The rotation to apply.

Returns
Vector3

The transformed vector.

TransformNormal(Vector3,Matrix4x4)

Transforms a vector normal by the given 4x4 matrix.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 TransformNormal (System.Numerics.Vector3 normal, System.Numerics.Matrix4x4 matrix);
normal
Vector3

The source vector.

matrix
Matrix4x4

The matrix.

Returns
Vector3

The transformed vector.

Adds two vectors together.

right
Vector3

The second vector to add.

Returns
Vector3

The summed vector.

Remarks

The Addition method defines the addition operation for Vector3 objects.

op_Division(Vector3,Vector3)

Divides the first vector by the second.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 op_Division (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector.

right
Vector3

The second vector.

Returns
Vector3

The vector that results from dividing left by right.

Remarks

The Division method defines the division operation for Vector3 objects.

op_Division(Vector3,Single)

Divides the specified vector by a specified scalar value.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 op_Division (System.Numerics.Vector3 value1, float value2);
value1
Vector3

The vector.

value2
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Vector3

The result of the division.

Remarks

The Division method defines the division operation for Vector3 objects.

op_Equality(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns a value that indicates whether each pair of elements in two specified vectors is equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Vector3

The first vector to compare.

right
Vector3

The second vector to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if left and right are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two Vector3 objects are equal if each element in left is equal to the corresponding element in right.

op_Inequality(Vector3,Vector3)

Returns a value that indicates whether two specified vectors are not equal.

Boolean

left
Vector3

right

Returns
Vector3

The product vector.

Remarks

The Multiply method defines the multiplication operation for Vector3 objects.

op_Multiply(Vector3,Single)

Multiples the specified vector by the specified scalar value.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 op_Multiply (System.Numerics.Vector3 left, float right);
left
Vector3

The vector.

right
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Vector3

The scaled vector.

Remarks

The Multiply method defines the multiplication operation for Vector3 objects.

op_Multiply(Single,Vector3)

Multiples the scalar value by the specified vector.

public static System.Numerics.Vector3 op_Multiply (float left, System.Numerics.Vector3 right);
left
Single

The vector.

right

The scalar value.

Subtracts the second vector from the first.

left
Vector3

op_UnaryNegation(Vector3)

Remarks
